structured_content.content: I discovered this winter salad while looking for a fresh side dish for holiday dinners. It quickly became a favorite among family and friends, adding a burst of color to our festive table.

• Primary component: fresh greens - they provide a crisp base for the salad
  • Essential aromatics/flavor elements: juicy oranges - they add sweetness and brightness
  • Complementary components: crunchy pecans - they offer a satisfying crunch
  • Required tools: large bowl, knife, cutting board

note.label: Essential Knowledge
note.content:
• Use a variety of greens for added flavor
  • Avoid over-dressing the salad to keep it fresh
  • Look for vibrant oranges for the best taste
  • Store leftovers in an airtight container for up to a day

structured_content.content: Every time I serve this winter salad, it brings smiles and compliments from my family. It's a reminder that healthy meals can be both beautiful and delicious, making it a staple on our holiday table.
Add a drizzle of balsamic glaze for extra flavor, or include some feta cheese for a salty contrast. A sprinkle of pomegranate seeds can also enhance the festive look and taste.
Serve this salad alongside roasted meats or as part of a buffet spread. It pairs well with crusty bread or a warm grain dish for a complete meal.
Substitute oranges with grapefruit for a tangy twist, or use walnuts instead of pecans for a different flavor. For a vegan option, skip any cheese and use a plant-based dressing.
